00020   ######################################################################
00021   ## \return Returns the pathname to the TKE directory.
00022   proc get_plugin_directory {interp pname} {
00023 
00024     set plugin_dir [file join $::tke_dir plugins $pname]
00025 
00026     if {[$interp issafe]} {
00027       return [::safe::interpFindInAccessPath $interp $plugin_dir]
00028     } else {
00029       return $plugin_dir
00030     }
00031 
00032   }
00033

00039 
00040     if {[$interp issafe]} {
00041       return [::safe::interpFindInAccessPath $interp $img_dir]
00042     } else {
00043       return $img_dir
00044     }

00048   ######################################################################
00049   ## \return Returns the pathname to the user's home tke directory.
00050   proc get_home_directory {interp pname} {
00051 
00052     # Figure out the home directory
00053     set home [file join $::tke_home plugins $pname]
00054 
00055     # If the home directory does not exist, create it
00056     file mkdir $home
00057 
00058     if {[$interp issafe]} {
00059       return [::safe::interpFindInAccessPath $interp $home]
00060     } else {
00061       return $home
00062     }
00063 
00064   }

00094   ######################################################################
00095   ## Invokes the given menu path.
00096   #
00097   # \param menu_path  Hierarchical menu path (separated by '/') to invoke.
00098   proc invoke_menu {interp pname menu_path} {
00099 
00100     # Get the menu path
00101     set menu_path [split $menu_path /]
00102 
00103     # Get the parent menu
00104     set parent [menus::get_menu [lrange $menu_path 0 end-1]]
00105 
00106     # Invoke the menu entry in the parent
00107     menus::invoke $parent [lindex $menu_path end]
00108 
00109   }
00110 
00111   ######################################################################
00112   ## Displays the given message string in the information bar.  The
00113   #  message must not contain any newline characters.
00114   #
00115   #  \param msg    Message to display in the information bar
00116   #  \param delay  Specifies the amount of time to wait before clearing the message
00117   proc show_info {interp pname msg {clear_delay 3000}} {
00118 
00119     # Displays the given message
00120     gui::set_info_message $msg $clear_delay
00121 
00122   }

00124   ######################################################################
00125   ## Displays a widget that allows the user to provide input.  This
00126   #  procedure will block until the user has either provided a response
00127   #  or has cancelled the input by hitting the escape key.
00128   #
00129   #  \param msg         Message to display next to input field (prompt)
00130   #  \param pvar        Reference to variable to store user input to
00131   #  \param allow_vars  If set to 1, variables embedded in string will have
00132   #                     substitutions performed; otherwise, the raw string
00133   #                     will be returned.
00134   #
00135   #  \return Returns a list containing two elements.  The first element is set to a
00136   #          1 if the user provided input; otherwise, returns 0 to indicate that the
00137   #          user cancelled the input operation.  The second item is the user provided
00138   #          value (if the first value is set to 1).
00139   proc get_user_input {interp pname msg pvar {allow_vars 1}} {
00140 
00141     set var ""
00142 
00143     if {[gui::user_response_get $msg var $allow_vars]} {
00144       $interp eval set $pvar [list $var]
00145       return 1
00146     }
00147 
00148     return 0
00149 
00150   }

00163     ######################################################################
00164     ## \return Returns the file information at the given file index.
00165     #
00166     #  \param file_index  Unique file identifier that is passed to some plugins.
00167     #  \param attr        File attribute to retrieve.  The following values are
00168     #                     valid for this option:
00169     #                     - \b fname    : Normalized file name
00170     #                     - \b mtime    : Last mofication timestamp (in seconds)
00171     #                     - \b lock     : Specifies the current lock status of the file
00172     #                     - \b readonly : Specifies if the file is readonly
00173     #                     - \b modified : Specifies if the file has been modified since the last save.
00174     #                     - \b sb_index : Specifies the index of the file in the sidebar.
00175     proc get_info {interp pname file_index attr} {
00176 
00177       return [gui::get_file_info $file_index $attr]
00178 
00179     }
00180 
00181     ######################################################################
00182     ## Adds a file to the browser.  If the first argument does not start with
00183     #  a '-' character, the argument is considered to be the name of a file
00184     #  to add.  If no filename is specified, an empty/unnamed file will be added.
00185     #  All other options are considered to be parameters.
00186     #
00187     #   -savecommand \e command
00188     #     * Specifies the name of a command to execute after
00189     #       the file is saved.
00190     #
00191     #   -lock (0|1)
00192     #     * If set to 0, the file will begin in the unlocked
00193     #       state (i.e., the user can edit the file immediately).
00194     #     * If set to 1, the file will begin in the locked state
00195     #       (i.e., the user must unlock the file to edit it)
00196     #
00197     #   -readonly (0|1)
00198     #     * If set to 1, the file will be considered readonly
00199     #       (i.e., the file will be locked indefinitely); otherwise,
00200     #       the file will be able to be edited.
00201     #
00202     #   -sidebar (0|1)
00203     #     * If set to 1 (default), the file's directory contents
00204     #       will be included in the sidebar; otherwise, the file's
00205     #       directory components will not be added to the sidebar.
00206     #
00207     #   -saveas (0|1)
00208     #     * If set to 0 (default), the file will be saved to the
00209     #       current file; otherwise, the file will always force a
00210     #       save as dialog to be displayed when saving.
00211     #
00212     #   -buffer (0|1)
00213     #     * If set to 0 (default, the file will be added as a normal file;
00214     #       however, if set to 1, the file will be treated as a temporary file
00215     #       that will be automatically deleted when the tab is closed.
00216     #
00217     #   -gutters \e list
00218     #     * Creates a gutter in the editor.  The contents of list are as follows:
00219     #       \code {name {{symbol_name {symbol_tag_options+}}+}}+ \endcode
00220     #       For a list of valid symbol_tag_options, see the options available for
00221     #       tags in a text widget.
00222     proc add {interp pname args} {
00223 
00224       set fname ""
00225       array set opts [list]
00226 
00227       # If no filename is given, add a new file to the editor
00228       if {([llength $args] > 0) && ([string index [lindex $args 0] 0] ne "-")} {
00229 
00230         # Peel the filename from the rest of the arguments
00231         set args [lassign $args fname]
00232 
00233         # Check to make sure that the file is safe to add to the editor, and
00234         # if it is, create the normalized pathname of the filename.
00235         if {[set fname [interpreter::check_file $pname $fname]] eq ""} {
00236           return -code error "permission error"
00237         }
00238 
00239       }
00240 
00241       # If we have an odd number of arguments, we have an error condition
00242       if {[expr [llength $args] % 2] == 1} {
00243         return -code error [msgcat::mc "Argument list to api::add_file was not an even key/value pair"]
00244       }
00245 
00246       # Get the options
00247       array set opts $args
00248 
00249       # If the -savecommand option was given, wrap it in an interp eval call
00250       # so that we don't execute the command in the master interpreter.
00251       if {[info exists opts(-savecommand)]} {
00252         set opts(-savecommand) "$interp eval $opts(-savecommand)"
00253       }
00254 
00255       # Change out the gutter commands with interpreter versions
00256       if {[info exists opts(-gutters)]} {
00257         set new_gutters [list]
00258         foreach gutter $opts(-gutters) {
00259           set new_sym [list]
00260           foreach {symname symopts} [lassign $gutter gutter_name] {
00261             set new_symopts [list]
00262             foreach {symopt symval} $symopts {
00263               switch $symopt {
00264                 "-onenter" -
00265                 "-onleave" -
00266                 "-onclick" {
00267                   lappend new_symopts $symopt "$interp eval $symval"
00268                 }
00269                 default {
00270                   lappend new_symopts $symopt $symval
00271                 }
00272               }
00273             }
00274             lappend new_sym $symname $new_symopts
00275           }
00276           lappend new_gutters [list $gutter_name {*}$new_sym]
00277         }
00278         set opts(-gutters) $new_gutters
00279       }
00280 
00281       # Finally, add the new file
00282       if {$fname eq ""} {
00283         gui::add_new_file end {*}[array get opts]
00284       } else {
00285         gui::add_file end $fname {*}[array get opts]
00286       }
00287 
00288       # Allow the plugin to manipulate the ctext widget
00289       set txt [gui::current_txt {}]
00290       $interp alias $txt $txt
00291 
00292       return $txt
00293 
00294     }
00295 
00296   }

00309     ## \return Returns the value for the specified attribute of the
00310     #          file/directory in the sidebar with the given index.

00313     #  \param attr      Attribute to return the value of.  Valid attribute
00314     #                   names are:
00315     #                   - \b fname      : Normalized name file or directory
00316     #                   - \b file_index : If not set, indicates the file has
00317     #                                     not been opened in the editor; otherwise,
00318     #                                     specifies the file index of the opened
00319     #                                     file.
00320     proc get_info {interp pname sb_index attr} {
00321 
00322       return [sidebar::get_info $sb_index $attr]
00323 
00324     }

00328   namespace eval plugin {
00329 
00330     ######################################################################
00331     ## Saves the value of the given variable name to non-corruptible memory
00332     #  so that it can be later retrieved when the plugin is reloaded.
00333     #
00334     #  \param index  Unique value that is passed to the on_reload save command.
00335     #  \param name   Name of the variable to store
00336     #  \param value  Variable value to store
00337     proc save_variable {interp pname index name value} {
00338 
00339       plugins::save_data $index $name $value
00340 
00341     }
00342 
00343     ######################################################################
00344     ## Retrieves the value of the named variable from non-corruptible memory
00345     #  (from a previous save_variable call.
00346     #
00347     #  \param index  Unique value that is passed to the on_reload retrieve command.
00348     #  \param name   Name of the variable to get the value of.  If the named variable
00349     #                could not be found), an empty string is returned.
00350     proc load_variable {interp pname index name} {
00351 
00352       return [plugins::restore_data $index $name]
00353 
00354     }
00355 
00356   }

00360     ######################################################################
00361     ## Opens the given file in a file browser.  If in_background is set to
00362     #  a value of 1, the focus will remain in the editor; otherwise, focus
00363     #  will be given to the opening application.
00364     proc open_file {interp pname fname {in_background 0}} {
00365 
00366       utils::open_file_externally $fname $in_background
00367 
00368     }
